column4: hey how do i login as the administrator to remove the settings of a system file from it's read only status
hey guys someone can help me out here
was wonderin how to change the settings of a document (removin read only) status
if you still want more, "man chmod", like "chmod +w foo"
okay, you can "sudo chmod a+w foo"
don't change any system files, only change your own
don't do chmod to change resolution, try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
ask here before you do something to the system, or read a howto
Ctl-C here, and Ctl-Shift-V in gnome-terminal
followinig the wiki is a good way
are you sure you set enable video for video in bios? like more than 8MB
check bios, reboot, enter bios, find out howmuch video ram is reserved, make it larger than 8MB
